page.title: 18Poynton Station
page.content: Poynton Station opened on 1st September, 1887. It replaced an earlier station built in Lostock Road in 1845 by the London, Manchester and Birmingham Railway. The present station was built by the London North_Western Railway Company. It has first and second class waiting rooms,a station master's office, a porter's rest-room and ticket office. There are canopies to provide covered portions to the platforms. The substantial and elaborate nature of the buildings is the result of the influence of Lord Vernon, the local landowner. There was a petition in 1979 to make the station a listed building but this was not successful. It is a suburban station mainly for commuters.
